revised_title: Preliminary Account of the Total Eclipse of the Sun in 1901
tldr: This article describes the preparations and observations made by a team of astronomers during the total solar eclipse of May 18, 1901, at Pulo Aoer Gadang, West Coast of Sumatra. The team, led by F. W. Dyson, used various instruments and techniques to study the solar corona and other phenomena related to the eclipse.
